sub_title:
A solution-oriented double BSc graduate with a passion for complex problem solving, mathematics, data analysis, and upskilling || Always keen for a challenge! ||

(BSc Physics, BSc Liberal Arts and Sciences)
summary:
I have recently graduated cum laude, with a double degree. One in Physics and the other in Liberal Arts and Sciences. My broad academic background gives me a unique perspective on problems and challenges and allows me to seek and produce well rounded, creative, and effective solutions. I have a strong background in data analysis and problem-solving and my analytical skills are sharp and polished. "How can this be improved?" is a question that rings constantly in the back of my mind when I approach any task. I am always seeking to find more efficient and effective solutions to problems, challenges, and tasks I pursue.

I am passionate about applied physics and mathematics, machine learning, data visualization, and problem-solving. Furthermore, I am highly motivated to produce high-quality work, I do this by maintaining focus and an eye for detail. I have fantastic analytical and problem-solving abilities and intermediate programming, numerical, and software development skills. I enjoy dissecting complex problems into smaller more focused pieces, before tackling the entire problem. This allows me to not only have a holistic picture of the problem at hand but allows me to effectively explain complex and technical systems and solutions to a non-technical audience.  Beyond my technical abilities, I have excellent and well developed interpersonal skills. I value creating and maintaining strong and reliable relationships with colleagues and clients.

awards.title: Cum Laude Certificate
awards.description: My degree program was completed with a cum laude distinction. This achievement is a testament to my work ethic and my ability to efficiently produce high-quality work.

awards.title: Outstanding Cambridge Learner Award
awards.description: Gained the highest grade in South Africa for AS-Level Chemistry

awards.title: Certificate of Merit
awards.description: Certificates of Merit awarded for my efforts and achievements in A-Level: Physics, Mathematics, and Chemistry.

projects.title: Bachelor Research Project
projects.description:
I am very proud to have been awarded an A (8.5) for my bachelor research project. I will post the research paper here in the near future. As it stands, the results are being kept privately by the Soft Condensed Matter and Biophysics (SCMB) group for future research and publications, a great honor. I really appreciate the guidance and support from my research supervisor, Dr. L Fillion, and my research team at the institute. 

My research project, entitled "Extracting the interaction force profile
from noisy colloidal trajectories", reported and expanded on a newly presented method that allows for the determination of the interparticle force profile from particle trajectories.  Using numerical simulations of nano-particles (colloids) -- Programmed in C -- I generated many data sets of particle trajectories in a range of systems. These data sets were then analyzed extensively in Python using a variety of statistical and numerical methods, which ultimately led to the successful extraction of the interaction force profiles.

During this valuable time, I gained many technical and professional skills. I learned how to program in C during the project, in order to write the code to execute and record data from the numerical simulations. I also become much more proficient with using LaTex while writing the lengthy report. Furthermore, I provided weekly reports and presentations to the research group, updating them on my progress, and answering questions any of the team members may have had.  Overall, this was a fantastic challenge and experience.

contributors.headline:
A solution-oriented double BSc graduate with a passion for complex problem solving, mathematics, data analysis, and upskilling || Always keen for a challenge! ||

(BSc Physics, BSc Liberal Arts and Sciences)

projects.title: Modeling and Analysis of Astronomical Data
projects.description: During my studies, I enrolled in an elective course which was a project that studied the correlation between atmospheric weather conditions and the frequency of cosmic rays. This was a big data challenge as it involved correlating and unifying large amounts of atmospheric and cosmic ray data. The analysis was done in Python and we were able to confirm a correlation between weather conditions and cosmic ray frequency. The results were used by a team of researchers at NIKHEF in Amsterdam.

contributors.headline:
A solution-oriented double BSc graduate with a passion for complex problem solving, mathematics, data analysis, and upskilling || Always keen for a challenge! ||

(BSc Physics, BSc Liberal Arts and Sciences)

profile_positions.description:
My bachelor thesis project involved performing numerical simulations of nano-particles and tracking their trajectories. With this simulation data, I performed extensive numerical and statistical analysis on the particle trajectories to extract the forces these particles exert on each other. 

This project allowed me to gain many new skills, not only technically but professionally too. I had to provide weekly reports and presentations to the research group, updating them on my progress, and answering questions any of the team members may have had. The corona pandemic and following lockdowns started in the middle of my research project, introducing numerous organizational challenges. In spite of these difficulties, I am very proud to have completed my research on time and to have earned an A (8.5) for this project.
profile_positions.title: Bachelor Student Researcher

profile_positions.description:
During my university degree, I took up the position of the teaching assistant for two introductory university physics courses:
1) Waves and optics
2) Electrodynamics

In these positions, I assisted the leading professors with multiples tasks. This included answering students' conceptual and technical questions relating to the course contents, the problem sets, and assignments. Above this, I also assisted with the marking of assignments and examinations and communications within the courses.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description:
I developed a laboratory android application used to compute pH changes in systems. This calculator style application can be used to determine the pH change that occurs upon the addition of a certain reagent. Furthermore, the application determines the quantities and concentrations of reagents that would be required to obtain a specified pH change. This application, although simple, helps streamline work in the lab by eliminating the time required to do cumbersome calculations. 

I was responsible for designing and building both the front-end and the back-end of this application. This was done using Android Studio software and programmed in Java and XML.
profile_positions.title: Android Developer

profile_positions.description: Science tutor for University students. This role involved helping struggling students understand the content of their science courses. A major challenge was to pinpoint exactly which gap in knowledge was causing a misunderstanding for the student. Once the issue was located, we focused on bridging this gap to provide students with a holistic view of the content, helping them see the link between what they already know and what they are trying to learn.
profile_positions.title: Science Student Assistant

profile_positions.location: City of Johannesburg, Gauteng, South Africa
profile_positions.description:
Prior to my university degree, I worked as a chemical analyst intern for Hydrance Water Expertise, an industrial and commercial water treatment company specializing in innovative chemical products. 

The position was based in the lab and involved carrying out and reporting the analyses of various water samples. The information obtained from this analysis was then used to decide the appropriate products, treatement method, and processes that would be implemented for treatment. This role offered me invaluable hands-on experience in the water treatment industry and great lab and technical skills.
profile_positions.title: Analytical Chemist Intern
